question: 俺たち
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>I</kanji> plus <ja>たち</ja> is <vocabulary>we</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>us</vocabulary>. Remember <ja>私達</ja>? It's just like that, except that <ja>俺</ja> is much more casual and rough sounding, so be careful to use it only with close friends friends, or when you're shaking someone down.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the one you learned with the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
